document_data.name: Hendak
document_data.mainbody: '''Hendak''' was a gladiator and slave who lived in captivity during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]]. He was previously a warrior, before being ripped away from his life in [[the North]] .
document_data.Description: He was a proud man and quite the skilled combatant.
document_data.History:
At some point, Hendak was captured by slavers and taken to the city of [[Athkatla]]. He was forced to fight as a gladiator in the fighting pits hidden away in the slums behind the [[Copper Coronet]] inn. 

Hendak endured his imprisonment and forced combat for years, at least until the {{YearlinkName|1369}}. He did his best to keep the other slaves alive and boost their spirits, to limited success. Hendak wanted nothing more than to enact vengeance upon the Coronet's owner [[Lehtinan]] and free the others who were enslaved.
